textWithDelay.text: Open your eyes
Wake up!
I gave the chance to 194 other friends besides you, but
89...no, for 6000 years, I never gave up on the code, and you were the only one ready by the time I arrived.
So, I’ll give you the second mission.
Your second mission as a developer is...
To wake the planets in the solar system, from Sunday to Saturday, and even the Sun.
Travel through this universe and wake up all the planets in the solar system that are asleep.
That's all. It's simple, right?
Before you start, let me introduce you to two features that will help you.
Do you see the 100% button at the bottom right?
Tap it once.
Now, you should be able to zoom out the screen for better visibility.
You can adjust the scale depending on your situation and use it as you like.
Second,
Unlike before, this place will be more spacious.
Previously, you may have found the next stage by yourself, but here, it's bigger than you think.
So, I’ve made a navigation feature to guide you to the next destination.
Do you see the small arrows at the edges of the screen?
From now on, you can follow the direction of the arrows to find the next stage.
Good...
I’d love to let you wander around freely, but
For now, we should start step by step according to your current skills.
So, let’s start with the small solar system in front of you.
Did you see the green one flying just now?
You gained that power by winning just now, and
Now you should be able to shoot the same thing.
I’ll explain how to shoot it in the next stage, so keep going for now.
Oh... did you successfully complete the Sun stage?

Good, good...
Then, I can’t not give you the third mission.
Your third mission is...
Until now, you’ve been playing inside the solar system, but
Now you’ll wake up all the planets in the universe.
And if all the planets are lit up...
Let’s go meet the final boss who created this world.
You’re not strong enough now, but
By that time, you should be able to face them.
Keep improving your skills and prepare from now on.
From now on, I’ll be silent.
But I’ll always be watching.
If you want to move fast over long distances,
Zoom out to 1% and scroll. It’ll be much faster.
And if you see a planet where you need to stop,
Set the zoom to 75~50% and scroll. You’ll have more precision.
This is a real pro tip, so don’t forget it!
Also, I feel like you weren’t listening properly, so I’ll say it again.
If you want to move fast over long distances,
Zoom out to 1% and scroll. It’ll be much faster.
And if you see a planet where you need to stop,
Set the zoom to 75~50% and scroll. You’ll have more precision.
...Did you get it?
If you don’t understand, just say so.
This one might be a bit tough.
It’s the first mid-boss.
You should go in with a bit of tension.
Have you ever seen a planet that's moving?
Actually, it's a planet that's rotating.
What's the difference between a moving planet and a stationary one?
A moving planet will be a bit harder than a stationary one.
So, the planet you're about to enter... is rotating?
I think it's going to be a bit tough, but go in.
Do you know a game called The Sims?
...Forget it.
This is already the second mid-boss.
This one's going to be harder.
Let me say something encouraging.
Every stage you've completed so far.
It's obvious, but I cleared them all too.
...Without any items.
I did it, so you can do it too.
Good luck.
Alright...
There's really not much left now.
From now on, the difficulty level is going to change.
But you've done well so far, right?
Good luck.
Wow, finally!
The stage you just cleared is the last stage prepared for this game.
Actually, there's one more left.
It's time to meet the final boss.
What are you doing? Aren't you going?
Ah... navigation....
You don't need that anymore.
Have you ever seen the edge of the universe while wandering around here?
This time, I'll show you the way myself.
The last place you need to go is...
The end of this universe.
Where is the end of the universe, you ask?
You're asking me, the one who created this universe?
It's really almost there.
Try finding the end of this universe.
So...
You've seen the ending, why are you here again?
Did you just come to hang out?
...Ok
